intro: Hordeum vulgare var. glabribrevisetum, commonly known as the slender barley, is a variant of barley characterized by its reduced awn length and smooth surface. It is an annual grass species native to temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, with slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets arranged in a panicle, bearing small, two-rowed grains. This variety is often cultivated for its high yield and adaptability to various agricultural conditions.
